Class ViewObject

Represents the visual state of a SceneObject in a View.

Summary
  • Contained in View.objects and ViewLayer.objects
  • Created automatically for each existing SceneObject
  • Registered by ViewObject.id in View.objects
  • Use ViewLayers to organize ViewObjects

Overview

Every View automatically maintains within itself a ViewObject for each SceneObject that exists in the Viewer's Scene.

Whenever we create a SceneObject, each View will automatically create a corresponding ViewObject within itself. When we destroy a SceneObject, each View will automatically destroy its corresponding ViewObject. The ViewObjects in a View are therefore a manifest of the SceneObjects in the Scene.

ViewLayer.

clippable

  • get clippable(): boolean
  • set clippable(value: boolean): void
    • Defined in packages/viewer/src/viewer/view/ViewObject.ts:267

    Gets if this ViewObject is clippable.

    • Clipping is done by the SectionPlanes in {@link ViewLayer.sectionPlanes}.
    • Use ViewLayer.setObjectsClippable to batch-update the clippable state of ViewObjects.

    Returns boolean

    • Defined in packages/viewer/src/viewer/view/ViewObject.ts:277

    Sets if this ViewObject is clippable.

    • Clipping is done by the SectionPlanes in {@link ViewLayer.sectionPlanes}.
    • Use ViewLayer.setObjectsClippable to batch-update the clippable state of ViewObjects.

    Parameters

    • value: boolean

    Returns void

collidable

  • get collidable(): boolean
  • set collidable(value: boolean): void
    • Defined in packages/viewer/src/viewer/view/ViewObject.ts:292

    Gets if this ViewObject is included in boundary calculations.

    • When true, the 3D World boundaries returned by {@link ViewLayer.aabb} and {@link ViewLayer.getAABB} will include this ViewObject's boundary.
    • The ViewObject's 3D boundary is held in SceneObject.aabb.
    • Use ViewLayer.setObjectsCollidable to batch-update the collidable state of ViewObjects.

    Returns boolean

    • Defined in packages/viewer/src/viewer/view/ViewObject.ts:303

    Sets if this ViewObject included in boundary calculations.

    • When true, the 3D World boundaries returned by {@link ViewLayer.aabb} and {@link ViewLayer.getAABB} will include this ViewObject's boundary.
    • The ViewObject's 3D boundary is held in SceneObject.aabb.
    • Use ViewLayer.setObjectsCollidable to batch-update the collidable state of ViewObjects.

    Parameters

    • value: boolean

    Returns void

colorize

  • get colorize(): Float32Array
  • set colorize(value: FloatArrayParam): void
    • Defined in packages/viewer/src/viewer/view/ViewObject.ts:345

    Gets the RGB colorize color for this ViewObject.

    • Multiplies by rendered fragment colors.
    • Each element of the color is in range [0..1].
    • Use ViewLayer.setObjectsColorized to batch-update the colorized state of ViewObjects.

    Returns Float32Array

    • Defined in packages/viewer/src/viewer/view/ViewObject.ts:357

    Sets the RGB colorize color for this ViewObject.

    • Multiplies by rendered fragment colors.
    • Each element of the color is in range [0..1].
    • Set to null or undefined to reset the colorize color to its default value of [1,1,1].
    • Use ViewLayer.setObjectsColorized to batch-update the colorized state of ViewObjects.

    Parameters

    • value: FloatArrayParam

    Returns void

culled

  • get culled(): boolean
  • set culled(culled: boolean): void
    • Defined in packages/viewer/src/viewer/view/ViewObject.ts:243

    Gets if this ViewObject is culled.

    • The ViewObject is only rendered when ViewObject.visible is true and ViewObject.culled is false.
    • Use ViewLayer.setObjectsCulled to batch-update the culled state of ViewObjects.

    Returns boolean

    • Defined in packages/viewer/src/viewer/view/ViewObject.ts:253

    Sets if this ViewObject is culled.

    • The ViewObject is only rendered when ViewObject.visible is true and ViewObject.culled is false.
    • Use ViewLayer.setObjectsCulled to batch-update the culled state of ViewObjects.

    Parameters

    • culled: boolean

    Returns void

    • When ViewObject.highlighted is true the ViewObject will be registered by ViewObject.id in {@link ViewLayer.highlightedViewObjects}.
    • Use ViewLayer.setObjectsHighlighted to batch-update the highlighted state of ViewObjects.

    Returns boolean

opacity

  • get opacity(): number
  • set opacity(opacity: number): void
    • Defined in packages/viewer/src/viewer/view/ViewObject.ts:379

    Gets the opacity factor for this ViewObject.

    • This is a factor in range [0..1] which multiplies by the rendered fragment alphas.
    • Use ViewLayer.setObjectsOpacity to batch-update the opacities of ViewObjects.

    Returns number

    • Defined in packages/viewer/src/viewer/view/ViewObject.ts:390

    Sets the opacity factor for this ViewObject.

    • This is a factor in range [0..1] which multiplies by the rendered fragment alphas.
    • Set to null or undefined to reset the opacity to its default value of 1.
    • Use ViewLayer.setObjectsOpacity to batch-update the opacities of ViewObjects.

    Parameters

    • opacity: number

    Returns void

visible

  • get visible(): boolean
  • set visible(visible: boolean): void
    • Defined in packages/viewer/src/viewer/view/ViewObject.ts:118

    Gets if this ViewObject is visible.

    • When ViewObject.visible is true the ViewObject will be registered by ViewObject.id in {@link ViewLayer.visibleViewObjects}.
    • Each ViewObject is only rendered when ViewObject.visible is true and ViewObject.culled is false.
    • Use ViewLayer.setObjectsVisible to batch-update the visibility of ViewObjects, which fires a single event for the batch.

    Returns boolean

    • Defined in packages/viewer/src/viewer/view/ViewObject.ts:130

    Sets if this ViewObject is visible.

    • When ViewObject.visible is true the ViewObject will be registered by ViewObject.id in {@link ViewLayer.visibleViewObjects}.
    • Each ViewObject is only rendered when ViewObject.visible is true and ViewObject.culled is false.
    • Fires an "objectVisibility" event on associated ViewLayers.
    • Use ViewLayer.setObjectsVisible to batch-update the visibility of ViewObjects, which fires a single event for the batch.

    Parameters

    • visible: boolean

    Returns void

    • Use ViewLayer.setObjectsXRayed to batch-update the X-rayed state of ViewObjects.
